intro: Guillonea, commonly known as the sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, hibiscus-like flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the shoreline, where it thrives in saline and humid conditions. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to coastal environments.
